parameters.definition: Units of water required to hydrate one bag of subsoil
Units of water required to hydrate one bag of topsoil
Total number of bags of subsoil and topsoil combined available
Minimum number of bags of topsoil required

description: Both subsoil and topsoil need to be added to a garden bed. One bag of subsoil requires \param{SubsoilWater} units of water to hydrate while one bag of topsoil requires \param{TopsoilWater} units of water to hydrate every day. The truck used to transport the dirt has limited capacity and therefore, the farmer has available \param{TotalBags} bags of topsoil and subsoil combined. In addition, at least \param{MinTopsoil} bags of topsoil must be used. Since the topsoil is more expensive, at most \param{MaxTopsoilProportion} of all bags of soil can be topsoil. How many bags of each should be bought to minimize the total amount of water required to hydrate the garden bed?
